summary: Wilms tumor is a rare type of kidney cancer that typically occurs in children, but can also affect adults. It causes a tumor on one or both kidneys and is highly responsive to treatment, with a high cure rate. It can be associated with certain genetic conditions and birth defects.
causes: Alterations to genes such as WT1
Alterations to genes such as WT2
Nephrogenic rests (fragments of tissue that develop before birth and become cancerous after birth)
Acquired somatic mutations in CTNNB1 gene
Deletions in the p13 band on chromosome 11
